title: Luxury safari trip
text: We had a wonderful time at Elewana. All of the staff are so friendly and quick to respond to any request. Our guide Alex was great at pointing out all the animals, including finding a family with lion cubs we watched for over an hour. He enjoys his work and is completely respectful of the animals so although we were often very close to them they were always comfortable to carry on their life so we were able to enjoy watching their normal behavior. Simon and Jeremiah in the camp are the friendliest people that are so welcoming and eager to ensure we enjoyed our stay. Loved everything about our time here

title: Crowded and expensive
text: Used to love downtown Nashville, now Broadway feels like Bourbon st, crowds of drunks, extremely loud over priced bars. Get out if downtown to some of the other bars for a cheaper night out and better music

title: Concert here was tops
text: Lucky enough to get tickets for Josh Turner here, had done the tour a couple days earlier for the second time. They say in the tour that artists like to perform here for the acoustics and now I understand. Truly not a bad seat in the place, and the sound was better than any place I’ve been. If you get the chance to attend a performance here take it

title: Best food I’ve had in TN
text: So good I forgot to take a picture first. Pulled pork and sides, loved everything. Husband had the baked potato that is huge and loaded. Very nice people and excellent BBQ

title: Brunch, because Biscuit Love wait is crazy
text: Service is exceedingly slow, food is mediocre. Husband had the American breakfast and I had the hangover bowl. Best thing about the place is the decor and only 5 minute wait for a table. If you’re hungry it will do, but nothing to get excited about

title: Great location
text: Nice sized rooms, great location in West End. Our room did not have a fridge which was the only thing we missed. Air conditioning works great, everything was very clean. Large common courtyard that had a great view and seating. The only issue was some guests can get a little noisy in the courtyard but while we were there the noisy ones all went to bed by 10:30 so not too bad. Free breakfast is nice, plenty of food but nothing special. Convenient walking to anything in West End, and half moon bay is right in front of you steps from the door. Sunset from the courtyard

title: Best food I had in Roatan
text: Homemade tortellini with puttanesca sauce was so good, I wanted to lick my plate. Shared the chocolate salami for dessert, which was also delicious. Very reasonable prices, pizza looked awesome and I noticed a lot of locals coming and getting it for takeout. Not a lot of tables, but definitely go here for an Italian night.

title: Nice change from the typical island restaurant
text: Salad was delicious, pizza was good. Super nice staff, quick service and food was faster than most on the island

title: Relaxed beach bar
text: Cheap eats and drinks that are very good. Nice people, often have live music. Hamburgers are very good

title: Nicest staff ever, wonderful dives
text: My daughter (19) got her open water certification here and did another couple of fun dives. I went along on many of the dives to snorkel . I can’t imagine a nicer group of people to dive/snorkel with. Small groups, several times just my daughter, her instructor, and me and the boat captain. Alan, the boat captain snorkeled a couple of times with me and pointed out a lot of things I’d have missed. Paul the instructor was so kind and patient. Rino is fun to talk to about the island and the nudis he finds. If you want a small group dive with super nice people you can’t go wrong with Jackson’s

title: Interesting short tour and tasting
text: Another stop on our tour with Nicolas. Owner is very friendly and the tour is interesting. Kitron is not my favorite alcohol I’ve ever had, I did buy a bottle of the green to bring home and share

title: Lovely shop with local products
text: This was a stop on our tour with Nicolas. Shop owner is very friendly offering tastings if olive oil, olive paste and honey. I bought the thyme honey and olive oils and paste. All were delicious and reasonably priced. Stop here if you get to this village

title: Good food, very nice staff
text: Went on the recommendation of our food tour guide. I don’t like seafood very much, but my daughter wanted octopus. Went with our servers suggestions and had salad, grilled octopus and fish salad. Honestly didn’t expect to like the fish salad although our sever insisted I order it when I said I didn’t really care for fish. He was right, so glad I listened. The vinaigrette on the fish was delicious, would order that again. They bring a free dessert of yogurt and carrots that was scrumptious with a small shot of a liquor that I forget the name of.

title: Convenient location, noisy at night
text: The rooms are nice, very clean. Location is very close to the port and everything in Naxos town. Walk to the portera. There is a bar right next door that plays music until rather late 1:00 am, that kept us awake. The breakfast buffet is nothing to get excited about, we skipped it after the first day. Staff is nice.

title: Wonderful day exploring the island
text: Nicolas is full of information about everything Naxos. The Byzantine churches we saw with him would never have been possible on our own and his knowledge of the history is interesting and makes it a fascinating tour. The shops in the small villages we visited were lovely. You won’t go wrong booking a tour with Nicolas if you really want to see the island and learn about what you are seeing from the plants to the history to current life.

title: Wonderful evening food tour of Naxos town
text: I contacted Eleni and asked if she could do an evening food tour of Naxos town when we got off the ferry. She promptly responded with some questions about what we would like to do and the suggested a tour that sounded perfect and was exactly what I was looking for. Eleni was waiting at the hotel when we arrived as the ferry was a little later than scheduled. We first went to a wonderful cheese shop that is a must see in Naxos, we explored the Venetian castle, visited a more modern cheese shop and talked about the difference from the first one. Went for a lovely full dinner and then ended with a wine tasting at another must stop shop in Naxos. Eleni is sweet wonderful guide that feels like a friend not a guide by the end of the tour. Contact her if you want a tour on Naxos, she will not disappoint!

title: Perfect sunset views from your private balcony
text: Lovely room, very clean, excellent staff. Excellent sunset views with no crowds from your balcony. Breakfast buffet is excellent. If you want to be in town, then this might not be your place, but it’s walkable to Fira or take the hotel shuttle. Would be a lovely honey moon place.

title: So good we went back!
text: Oh my, Stavros is a wonderful chef, let him pick what you eat, you’ll be very full and so happy with his choices. My daughter and I went here on the recommendation of a friend. Thank goodness we did, Chef Stavros comes to the table to take your order, we didn’t really know what we wanted so we let him choose after he asked a few questions about what we liked. I’m so glad we left it up to him, everything was delicious. So good that when returned to Athens from the islands a few days later we ate our last meal in Athens here. Again left the choices up to him and he did not disappoint. The staff are also friendly, wonderful people that make you welcome and excellent service.

title: A must see, go early for uncrowded views
text: Isn’t it required to see the acropolis while visiting Athens? It’s worth it, but a short visit is fine.

title: Conveniently located
text: The hotel is a quick walk to Syntagma square, a reasonable walk to the acropolis. The staff are friendly. Stayed here one night on arrival to Athens and 2 more when returning from the islands. The breakfast buffet is decent, and was fine for us to start the day. Rooms are a decent size for Europe, nothing to get excited about but safe area and convenient

title: Dinner so good we went twice!
text: Our tour guide suggested this restaurant and made us a reservation. We went the full course from starter, pasta, second course and dessert. Everything was fabulous, so we went again our last night in Rome. Tried two different pastas, 2 different veal dishes (saltimboca was excellent). Wish I could go again. Prices quite reasonable too.

title: Wonderful tour, excellent food and guide!
text: We took the train from Florence to Bologna to join this day long tour of Parmesan, Prosciutto, Balsalmic, winery and excellent dinner. Our guide was great, the tours were interesting and included samples and wine at each stop. The ending meal was fantastic. Take this tour you won’t regret it.

title: lovely inn, convenient location
text: Definitely would stay here again, convenient to all the restaurants in Fell's Point. Right on the water, so beautiful and quiet, yet so convenient to everything in Baltimore. Rooms are spacious and lovely, staff is friendly, nicest place to stay in Baltimore.

title: Bites and sites tour
text: This tour was so much fun, Livvy is an excellent guide. The food was all excellent, and her explanations and knowledge of Budapest were exemplary. Can't recommend this one more and it's definitely made me interested in checking out urban adventure tours in other cities I visit.

title: Beautiful place, food is not so great
text: The first time we tried to go, the hostess rudely informed us they were completely booked that night and every night that week. Interestingly when we walked in with a Romanian guide who spoke the language we were able to get a reservation for the next night. It is a beautiful place, has traditional music and dancing for entertainment but the food was the least impressive we ate in our visit to Romania. Service was acceptable, waiter wasn't overly attentive but he wasn't rude and our food came faster than I expected based on other reviews. Save your time, go in and look around then go eat somewhere else. A lot of better restaurants in old town a few steps away from this one.

title: Beautiful and impressive
text: Well worth your time to go and take the tour. It's about an hour, you tour some impressive rooms and the guide is friendly and very informative of the history

title: Super nice owner
text: Arrived here on Nov 1, which is a big holiday in Hungary and almost everything in town was closed. We didn't have a reservation and were thankful to find something open. The hotel is clean and the beds were comfortable. The manager (owners maybe?) were so very nice and checked us in without even asking for a credit card. Charming place, room was a little small but we were just happy to find one.

title: Enjoyable dinner
text: One of the few places open on Nov 1 and we would have eaten anything and been happy to eat. But I thought we lucked out with this place. Cream of Broccoli soup was a wonderful start followed by a tradition Hungarian pork with homemade dumplings. Couldn't eat it all as portion was large but it was very good

title: Nice place, good food, excellent service
text: Went here at the recommendation of our taxi driver. We didn't have a reservation so we ate at one of the few bar style high tables. Our waiter was excellent, very helpful with the menu and helped my daughter find a wine she liked. We started with the meat appetizer, both of use chose the pork loin and dumplings (excellent) and I finished with the Hungarian dessert wine tasting. Only like the first one if those, but they were paired and presented nicely. Total bill was about $100. The most expensive meal we ate the whole trip, but the food was good, well presented, the music by the trio was very enjoyable and it would have cost more in the USA for a similar quality meal in the same atmosphere.

title: Fun place to visit/shop
text: Fun place to wonder around for an hour or so. Lots of different foods to buy, locals shipping here obviously for the vegetables and meats. Cooked food and gifts for the tourist.
